BOOK - MIDNIGHT SUN
AUTHOR - STEPHENIE MEYER 

MIDNIGHT SUN,
Midnight sun is a book I‚Äôve been waiting for so long and let me tell you, it was so worth the wait , THIS BOOK WAS EVERYTHING.

I love how Edward talks about reading his families minds and the different thoughts and struggles.midnight sun is exceptionally longer than the first Twilight book, but it‚Äôs within good reason. The amount of detailed thought and description is extraordinary.
There are some actions Edward follows through with that are questionable,He is constantly fighting with himself in his internal to be a good person. the way Bella reacts to him in every situation she clearly feels the same. In the two main instances in Twilight where I found Edward‚Äôs behaviour borderline creepy, And it‚Äôs not just the reader who is wondering what Edward is doing he is constantly worrying and is overly critical of his behaviour too .Edward‚Äôs relationships especially; Alice is so so sweet. Honestly the relationships between Edward and any Cullen touched my heart. This was honestly a lot better than I expected it to be. 

Definitely recommend Midnight Sun to Twilight Fans.

TAGS: #twilight #twilightforever #twilightislife #twilightislove #eclipsemovie #eclipse #twilightedit #bellaswan #bellaswanedit #edwardcullen #edwardcullenedit #victoria #riley #blood #scarifice #eclipsebook #edwardandbella

Book Review üí•‚Å£
Midnight Sun by Stephenie Meyer ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚Å£
‚Å£
After my disappointment with both The Testaments and Ballad of Songbirds and Snakes, I had the lowest expectations for Midnight Sun. ‚Å£
‚Å£
But I ended up flying through the book and totally enjoying it! Besides the nostalgia mentioned in the previous post, I loved the family dynamics amongst the Cullens and the character developments we did not get to see in Twilight. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Alice and Emmett have always been beloved, and their popularity is well-deserved. But to me, Emmett has always been somewhat flat, so I was happy to see an unexpectedly fraternal and tender side of him. ‚Å£
‚Å£
And I also want to apologize for underappreciating Jasper for so many years. His apparent aloofness is probably just a self-defense mechanism for that overwhelming emotional empathy, but both Edward and I learned more about his forbearance, psychological and supernatural in this book. ‚Å£
‚Å£
I also had a chance to further considered Edward‚Äôs characterization. On one hand, he had a century of experience and wisdom; on the other hand, he technically stopped psychologically maturing when he was seventeen. Meyer could have done a better job reconciliating these two sides, but such a paradox also makes him more vulnerable. I can‚Äôt say I now blame him any less for leaving in New Moon, but I do understand where it came from. ‚Å£
‚Å£
One problem I did have with the entire saga was the crudeness of the writing. The awkwardness of the phrases and repetitiveness of the descriptions had escaped me when I first read the books as a teenager, but I literally put them down for this very reason when I tried to reread them a few years ago. Unfortunately Meyer‚Äôs writing does not seem to have improved at all, giving Edward the linguistic style of a poorly educated modern teenager. I understand that Meyer might not be able to write as elegantly as an one-hundred-and-four-year-old with two medical degrees, but please get a better editor next time. ‚Å£
‚Å£
Or hire me. I can work for free, but only if you promise to write Edward‚Äôs version of Eclipse too.‚Å£

üìñ BOOK REVIEW üìñ 

Eclipse - Stephenie Meyer 

Happy Sunday Bookstagrammers!

Okay so finishing this book made me launch into binging all of the movies üòÇ
I enjoyed this book but not as much as the others, I think because it‚Äôs more of a lead up to the final book. 

3 ‚≠êÔ∏è 

I can really say I‚Äôm Team Edward, every part with Jacob in the books just makes me cringe üòÇüòÇ (though I will say in the movies the actors of Bella and Jacob have way more chemistry and it‚Äôs more believable)

There‚Äôs not much else to say here, it was good but not amazing! 

I can‚Äôt wait for the chat with my bookclub to find out what everyone else thought!

‚ú® BELLA SER√Å FOR√áADA A ESCOLHER ENTRE UMA AMIZADE PURA OU UM AMOR VERDADEIRO ‚ú® 

‚ùù O sol n√£o pode lutar contra a lua num eclipse. ‚ùû

üí≠ Um dos melhores livros da saga, super envolvente e fant√°stico. O leitor percorre pelos cap√≠tulos em busca do desfecho de cada evento, esbarrando-se com viradas emocionantes e surpreendentes.

üëâüèº Enfim, a hist√≥ria √© muito boa e os personagens est√£o mais maduros e perfeitamente amarrados. E o cen√°rio durante toda a hist√≥ria √© excelente e sombrio. üòä

üåó Para Bella, Jacob representa o Sol que dissipa suas "nuvens", e Edward representa a lua. A proximidade de Bella com Jacob, quase faz deles namorados. A frase que Jacob diz: "O sol n√£o pode lutar contra a lua num eclipse". Ou seja, por mais pr√≥ximo que Jacob esteja de Bella, nunca vai ocupar o lugar de Edward no seu cora√ß√£o. ü´¢

ü©∏A fita vermelha cortada na capa representa a escolha de Bella entre Edward e Jacob, significa tamb√©m que ela pode acabar com sua vida como humana. O vermelho √© para lembrar que se trata de uma hist√≥ria de vampiros, √© associado ao sangue de Bella t√£o desejado por Edward. üòèüôÉ

‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π Enquanto Seattle √© assolada por uma sequ√™ncia de assassinatos misteriosos e uma vampira maligna continua em sua busca por vingan√ßa, Bella est√° cercada de perigos outra vez. Em meio a isso, ela √© for√ßada a escolher entre seu amor por Edward e sua amizade com Jacob - sabendo que essa decis√£o tem o potencial para reacender o conflito perene entre vampiros e lobisomens.

ü•Ä Com a proximidade da formatura, Bella tem mais uma decis√£o a tomar: vida ou morte. Mas o que representar√° cada uma dessas escolhas‚Ä¶?!

‚ùù Das nuvens eu posso cuidar, mas n√£o posso lutar contra um eclipse. ‚ùû

‚ùù Eu volto logo pra que voc√™ n√£o precise sentir a minha falta. Tome conta do meu cora√ß√£o, eu deixei ele com voc√™. ‚ùû

‚ùù O meu cora√ß√£o √© igualmente silencioso‚Äù, ele meditou. ‚ÄúE ele tamb√©m agora √© seu.‚Äù ‚ùû

Reading Midnight Sun after being a Twilhard for so many years really made me nostalgic. ‚Å£
‚Å£
I do not know whether it is just me, but the whole concept of unconditional and irrevocable love really does not seem tangible anymore. ‚Å£
‚Å£
I remember having my first crush and being able to discern his footsteps from those of the rest of the class. ‚Å£
‚Å£
I remember clinging to my first boyfriend‚Äôs hand before stepping onto the plane and thinking that if I did not let go, I would never have to leave. ‚Å£
‚Å£
I remember grazing the edge my first girlfriend‚Äôs shirt with a finger, wishing I was part of the fabric so I could linger by her side for just a little longer. I remember the hope with which I opened my eyes every morning, know that she would be nearby. I remember seeing her for the last time right before she left for another continent, narcissistically thinking that the Philadelphia downpour outside was only an echo of our heartbreak at the inevitable ending. ‚Å£
‚Å£
How amusing they all seem in retrospect. ‚Å£
‚Å£
It has been years since I have tasted that all-consuming passion, so I am no longer in the mindset that would most resonate with Edward and Bella. Yet reading about them again, after not having touched the saga for years, made me reminiscent. ‚Å£
‚Å£
For a moment I was able to feel the tremor Bella must have felt every time she laid eyes on this gorgeous, superhuman being. For a second I could appreciate this ‚Äúaverage‚Äù human girl as Edward appraised her with incredulous and reverent eyes. ‚Å£
‚Å£
It was as if the Midnight Sun were a wormhole that transported its readers back into the 2000‚Äôs, to the small rainy town of Forks, and to the pink, delicate idealization of life-transformative love. When the book ended and the coldness of the New Moon re-emerged, this love became ludicrous once more. Yet for a brief moment, my youthful faith in a passionate love was rekindled, and I could not help but suspect that that even loneliest of frozen hearts could learn to beat again.

The matching Jacob to Edward. I was never a Jacob fanüòÇ

‚ÄîAUGUST 26, 2022

Happy Friday everyone! Long time no post üòÇ

Life has been a lot lately. I‚Äôm going through a breakup and getting ready to start my last semester of my didactic year. Shockingly, I‚Äôve actually been reading a lot! 

And I finally finished my Twilight re-read!

It was a wild ride since I haven‚Äôt read the books since middle school. I‚Äôve seen the movies several times but I‚Äôd forgotten how different they are at times. It was fun even if they‚Äôre not the best books ever 

QOTD: What was the last book you re-read?

Midnight Sun
Twilight - New Moon - Eclipse - Breaking Dawn
The Short Second Life of Bree Tanner 
By Stephanie Meyer üßõ

I have just finished reading Midnight Sun and woah it's intense!

If you've read Twilight you know how quick and fierce this love story is... But let me tell you, it's so much more when you are solely in Edwards head ü§Ø 

But I loved it! I would love the whole series from Edwards perspective especially New Moon because he's hardly there, but alas, I believe Meyer has no plans on this yet!

So as part of this post I am posting the Twilight Series. People may hate on the film's but I thought the books were incredible. 
I love a fantasy book and sometimes the more unbelievable and ridiculous the better!

For all above books mentioned;
